intro: Amaracarpus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved amara, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
